articles.title: Parents Speak Out After Deadly Minneapolis Catholic School Shooting
articles.description: Two children, 8-year-old Fletcher Merkel and 10-year-old Harper Moy, were killed, and 18 others injured, when a shooter opened fire during morning mass at Annunciation Catholic School in Minneapolis. Parents of the victims have spoken about their profound loss, and investigators are currently examining social media videos and writings from the suspected shooter to determine a motive. The tragic incident has reignited national conversations about school safety and gun control. [3, 7]

articles.title: Israel Declares Gaza City a Dangerous Combat Zone, Halts Humanitarian Pauses
articles.description: Israel's military has declared Gaza City a dangerous combat zone and suspended mid-day pauses for humanitarian aid delivery as it intensifies its offensive to seize the Gaza Strip's largest urban area. Drone, artillery, and fighter jet attacks have reportedly killed at least 41 Palestinians, including children, since dawn. UNICEF warns of a worsening starvation crisis in Gaza City due to Israel's ongoing blockade. [1, 2]

articles.title: Thailand's Constitutional Court Removes Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra from Office
articles.description: Thailand's constitutional court has removed Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra from office after finding her guilty of ethics violations. The ruling stemmed from a leaked phone call with Cambodia's former leader. This marks the fifth time since 2008 that a Thai prime minister has been removed from office by the country's top court. [1, 9]
